arm_group.description: healthy controls matched for age, gender, and BMI

brief_summary.textblock:
To explore electrophysiologic parameters and biomarkers predicting treatment response of
      patients with major depressive disorder To explore electrophysiologic parameters and
      biomarkers predicting suicide risk of patients with major depressive disorder

clinical_study.brief_title: Electrophysiologic Parameters and Biomarkers Predicting Treatment Response in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  DSM-IV-TR major depressive disorder

          -  aged between 20 and 80

          -  durg-naive or drug-free

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  DSM-IV-TR substance-related disorders (except nicotine)

          -  significant medical or neurological conditions

          -  mental retardation or organic brain damage

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study of Escitalopram Treatment and Biomarkers in Major Depressive Disorder

primary_outcome.description: the link between the normalized high frequency component of heart rate variability (HRV-HFnu) representing cardiac vagal modulation and frontal alpha power related to resting state
primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline frequency of maximum of cross-spectrum during 6 weeks (Hz)

reference.citation: Chang JS, Yoo CS, Yi SH, Her JY, Choi HM, Ha TH, Park T, Ha K. An integrative assessment of the psychophysiologic alterations in young women with recurrent major depressive disorder. Psychosom Med. 2012 Jun;74(5):495-500. doi: 10.1097/PSY.0b013e31824d0da0. Epub 2012 Mar 9.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: change in value of cross-sample entropy measured by combining sample entropies of heart rate and respiration
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cardiorespiratory coupling during 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: change in high frequency component of heart rate variability
change in disconnection pattern of EEG channel activities measured by Euclidean distance during 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in persistent homology during 6 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
